author: Mohammed Iqbal
text:
The Delhi High Court on Thursday issued a notice to Union Finance Minister Arun Jaitley on a petition filed by Aam Aadmi Party leader Ashutosh seeking deletion of some fresh allegations made by him in his civil defamation suit against Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and five others.

Justice Vipin Sanghi sought Mr. Jaitley’s response, by April 19, to the allegation that he had “exploited the opportunity” for filing a reply to introduce fresh charges of defamation, thus making out a fresh case.

Inconsistent

“The law does not permit any such subsequent pleading inconsistent with the original pleadings to be taken on record. Such pleadings are liable to be struck off,” Mr. Ashutosh said in his petition.

Counsel for Mr. Jaitley said the reply was a mere elaboration of the plaint which was part of the documents.

After counsel for Mr. Ashutosh sought to examine the tabulation of the plaintiff’s statements, the court made it clear that the suit proceedings before the Joint Registrar would not be postponed during the pendency of the petition.

In his defamation suit, Mr. Jaitley has sought Rs.10 crore in damages from Mr. Kejriwal and Mr. Ashutosh, among others. He alleged that they had made false and defamatory statements against him and his family in connection with the alleged irregularities in the Delhi and District Cricket Association when he was its president.

AAP leader seeks deletion of some fresh allegations made by Mr. Jaitley in his civil defamation suit against CM Kejriwal and five others
title: Court asks Jaitley to reply to Ashutosh plea
